main event: A civilian observer reported a balloon-like object slowly moving towards the western sky in Lakewood, Colorado on August 16, 1962.
interesting points: The object appeared round initially and later took on an elliptical shape with a hyperbola angle., The color of the object changed from gold to pink., The observer maintained constant observation, ruling out any aircraft it was near., The duration of the sighting was 30 minutes., There were numerous aircraft in the area, but this object was distinctly different and consistent with a balloon observation.
witness description: civilian observer, reliability rated 5 (excellent), electronics technician
